definition: as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: I’m not sure the whole truth ever came out.
sentences.chinese: 我無法肯定全部的真相最終能否水落石出。

sentences.english: The truth finally coming out, Zhang could not help tearing when being interviewed.
sentences.chinese: 一切水落石出，章子怡在接受採訪時泣不成聲。

sentences.english: Until I get to the bottom of it, I won't know what peace is.
sentences.chinese: 直到水落石出的那一天，不然我不知道什麼是安寧。

sentences.english: "the justice is inescapable, is sparse and is leakproof ", the matter has coming to light one day finally.
sentences.chinese: “天網恢恢，疏而不漏”，事情終有水落石出的一天。

sentences.english: Four flees vast for Ting, makes Ting's unjust charge to seem to be that comes to light the time.
sentences.chinese: 浩爲婷四出奔走，令婷的冤獄似有水落石出之期。

sentences.english: But the scale and nature of the attacks is also quickly realised.
sentences.chinese: 但這起襲擊事件的規模和本質也迅速水落石出。

sentences.english: We have to ravel the matter out.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須把事情弄個水落石出。

sentences.english: The matter settled shortly after the presentation of this information.
sentences.chinese: 這一信息的出現很快讓事情水落石出順利解決。

definition: the whole truth is revealed (idiom); everything becomes clear
culprit
to investigate thoroughly
lit. paper can't wrap fire; fig. the truth will out
to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
to float up (idiom); to become evident/to surface/to appear
conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
to be executed
the truth about sth/the actual facts
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
the dead cannot testify (idiom); dead men tell no tales
to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
